DOC.criteria: Single lesion Single vessel Reference vessel diameter 2.5 3.5 mm Lesion length ≤ 34 mm ≤ 34 mm stent length Stable angina require revascularization , patient unstable angina The patient difficulty enforce followup angiography Patient ≥ 20 year old Lesions graft vessel , thrombosis , restenosis , bifurcation require 2 stent Reference vessel diameter < 2.5 mm > 4.0mm Contraindication antiplatelet agent Treated DES within 3 month vessel Creatinine level ≥ 2.0 mg/dL ESRD Severe hepatic dysfunction ( 3 time normal reference value ) Patients LVEF < 30 % Life expectancy 1 year Lesions CTO leave main Target vessel STelevation MI Lesions require overlap stenting 2 DES vessel Heavy calcify lesion ( definite calcify lesion angiogram ) Far distal tortuous lesion difficulty OCT evaluation followup OCT Pregnant woman woman potential childbearing
